page.title: 12COUNTRY PARK - BRYN BACH
page.content: Bryn Bach Country Park is a large park on the outskirts of Tredegar. It was an open-cast mine, the large craters have been lined with plastic and then filled with water. They contain many fish and provide opportunity for many different water sports - sailing, skiing, windsurfing and fishing. The park is on a bleak mountain-side, it rains there often. There are many footpaths for people to use, running across from Tredegar to Rhymney. The park is for people to use, it will have an air strip and hangers, there will be a hotel and a camp site. Local school children have planted many different kinds of trees in the park. There are many different wild plants that must not be picked.
